meanings.sent1: She made a dotish mistake by forgetting her keys inside the locked car.
meanings.sent2: It was a dotish decision to go out without an umbrella when the forecast predicted rain.
meanings.sent3: His dotish actions often led to comical situations that made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dotish error in the calculations caused the entire project to fail.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his dotish behavior were evident to everyone around him.

meanings.definition: Acting in a silly or senseless manner
meanings.sent1: The clown's dotish antics entertained the children at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: She felt embarrassed by her dotish behavior at the company meeting.
meanings.sent3: His dotish dancing at the wedding reception brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The dotish way he tried to fix the broken vase only made it worse.
meanings.sent5: The dotish expressions on his face made it clear he was up to no good.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense
meanings.sent1: Her dotish remarks during the interview cost her the job opportunity.
meanings.sent2: The student's dotish answers on the test revealed a lack of preparation.
meanings.sent3: Despite his dotish decisions, he always managed to find a way out of trouble.
meanings.sent4: The dotish way he handled the delicate situation only made things worse.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his dotish choices were evident in the chaos that followed.
